results.title: A Waltz through the hills
results.creator_credit: Frank Arnold, Roz Berrystone, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by G.M. Glaskin, this multi-award winning adventure is about two young children who, after their mother dies, decide to run-away to England to stay with their only surviving relatives to avoid being put in separate orphanages. The first stage of the journey involves walking 107 kilometres from an inland West Australian wheat belt town to perth. They are befriended by a young aboriginal man and his family, survive a bush-fire, eat off the land and eventually reach Perth to media and public acclaim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Arnold, Roz Berrystone, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films

results.title: A Very British coup
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson, Sally Hibbin and Ann Skinner
results.brief_description: This is an absorbing political fable for the 90’s. Its a pacy thriller about an attempt to destabilise a fictitious British government. Harry Hopkins is an ex-steel worker from Sheffield who wins a General Election and becomes Prime Minister on a manifesto committed to radical policies. he is a man of the people who has a way with one-liners which fool the press but not the Opposition. Once inside Number 10, Harry enters a world of political intrigue and comes face to face with the media, the Civil Service, the armed forces, his own party and the Opposition. As each problem arises, Harry solves them in his own inimitable style. Cast: Ray McAnally, Alan MacNaughtan, Keith Allen.

results.title: A Union free seminar
results.creator_credit: Laszlo Barna, Laura Alper, Barrie Howells, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Techniques for union-proofing the workplace are presented in a concise, straightforward manner by Charles Hughes, management consultant and guru of the North American union-free movement. Excerpted from one of his popular management seminars, this film, and the information Hughes presents in it, will draw the attention of both union organizers and management.

results.title: A Trip to Mars
results.creator_credit: Ashley Miller and Edison Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: By mixing two power-like substances, a scientist discovers the source of reverse gravity. When he tries this concoction on himself, he is elevated to the planet Mars. This Edison Manufacturing Company production is reported to be the first science-fiction film produced in the United States.

results.title: A Very delicate matter (short version)
results.creator_credit: Claude Kerven, Patrick McCormick and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: A narrative which highlights the importance of honesty in sexual relationships where venereal disease is concerned. Stresses the responsibility to inform other sexual partners if one discovers one has the disease and indicates the possible consequences of the disease if it is left unchecked.

results.title: A Trip to the moon
results.creator_credit: William Peltz, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An imaginary rocket takes off to the moon and explores its surface. Describes conditions met in navigation to the moon. Once above the moon’s surface, shows in detail the craters and “seas”, the valleys and mountains that can be seen from the earth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Peltz, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: A Town that died: Walhalla
results.brief_description: Retraces the founding of the town of Walhalla after the discovery of gold. Illustrates the gold boom era, growth of the town and its eventual decline as the gold supply dimished.
results.description: Retraces the founding of the town of Walhalla after the discovery of gold. Illustrates the gold boom era, growth of the town and its eventual decline as the gold supply dimished.

results.title: A Time for drunken horses = Zaman baraye masti asbha [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bahman Ghobadi and Bahman Ghobadi Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Bahman Ghobadi “A Time for drunken horses” is an Iranian film set amid the mountainous border of Iran and Iraq. Ayoub (Ayoub Ahmadi) is a twelve-year-old Kurdish boy who is burdened with the economic responsibility of providing for his family. He has four bothers and sisters, one of whom is severely disabled. To eek out a living in the harsh landscape where his family live, Ayoub joins his uncle in a dangerous trade - taking pack mules loaded with truck tyres across the Iranian border to Iraq. The work is fraught with perils as the road is treacherous, bandits roam the terrain and rough weather impedes the journey. Once at the border Ayoub and his uncle ply their meagre goods, along with numerous others, for a pittance. Ayoub’s brother Madi is in need of a life saving operation that is prohibitively expensive for the impoverished family. Ayoub works against all the hazards to raise this necessary money. “A Time for drunken horses” has the feel and look of a documentary, one that expresses poignantly the trials of a valiant and resourceful child and his destitute people.

results.title: A Ticket in tatts
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film stars George Wallace as a disaster-prone stablehand who owns a whistle that can make Cup favorite Hotspur run faster. A sub-plot of the film concerns a high society romance where a young girl has undertaken to marry an ageing suitor if his horse defeats Hotspur in the Cup. Much of the shooting for this film was taken away from the usual studio scene to location scenes at a stud farm near Melbourne, the Flemington racecourse and in the grounds of a palatial Melbourne villa.

results.title: A Taste of Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
Includes marinated fillets of perch, Eisben-Leg of pork, cream cheese souffle with raspberry puree, eel soup, dumplings and spring chicken salad.
